sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Retired General Petro Pavel has won the Czech Republic's presidential election in a run-off vote, defeating billionaire Andrei Babis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Ten civilians killed as Russian artillery hits residential areas, but Ukraine claims it's hitting back with its own big guns.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A Palestinian teenager has shot and wounded two people in East Jerusalem following two days of deadly attacks in both the occupied West Bank and the Holy City.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Petr Prevel will be the Czech Republic's new president after confidently defeating his opponent, former Prime Minister Andrei Babis, in a runoff vote which ended Saturday afternoon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: On stage, the 61-year-old retired general thanked the people who cast ballots in this election and said that truth and humility won.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The new president will take his oath on March 9th after his predecessor Milo Zeman held office for 10 years and was considered by many to be a Euroskeptic politician. take his oath on March 9th after his predecessor Milo≈° Zeman held office for 10 years and was considered by many to be a Euro-skeptic politician.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: With the election of Petr Pavel, the Czech Republic will once again have a clearly pro-Western president. The former general supports the introduction of the Euro, military aid to Ukraine and, as he said during the campaign, he's not opposed to the legalization of same-sex marriage. Adam Magyar, Euronews the campaign, he's not opposed to the legalization of same-sex marriage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Adam Magyar, Euronews, Prague, Czech Republic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A new barrage of Russian shelling has killed at least 10 Ukrainian civilians

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: and wounded 20 others in a day, the office of Ukraine's president has said.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Regional officials said towns and villages in the east and in the south that are within reach of the Russian artillery suffered most.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Three people were killed and at least two others wounded following a Russian strike on the city of Konstantynivka in eastern Ukraine, the local governor said on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's army claims to have killed 109 soldiers and wounded another 188 in one day during fighting around Vuludar on Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A spokesman for its eastern command said fierce fighting was ongoing, but the enemy's efforts were unsuccessful.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: East Jerusalem is reeling after yet another violent attack. Police say a 13-year-old Palestinian opened fire near the historic Old Town and injured a father and son on Saturday morning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: According to their official spokesperson, the wounded assailant was overpowered and taken to hospital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This following a shooting at a synagogue on Friday night.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A Palestinian man killed seven people, including a 70-year-old woman, in what the state's foreign ministry says was one of the deadliest attacks on Israelis in years. The police say the gunman was shot dead after he tried to flee by car.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It comes as nine Palestinians were killed in a raid on a refugee camp in the occupied West Bank on Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Friday's shooting has set off public celebrations in both the West Bank and the Gaza Strip, where people fired guns into the air, honked car horns and distributed sweets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: School staff, including teachers, are demonstrating in Lisbon today to demand better pay and conditions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It's the third march since December organised by the Union of All Professionals of Education, also called STOP. They're demanding a 120 euro pay increase for all education professionals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The latest march came a day after Portugal's arbitration court ruled minimum standards and services must be upheld in schools given the unpredictability of action by STOP.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: of action by stop.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Extending a hand of friendship to Libya's Prime Minister and the government in Tripoli, but also here to secure Italy's future energy supplies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Giorgia Maloney's been Prime Minister for three months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This was her second visit to Africa in a week after a two-day trip to Algeria, the country that's become Italy's biggest supplier of energy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: During the trip to Libya, the country's two state-owned oil companies signed an $8 billion deal to develop Libya's offshore gas fields.
